# Setting up

Before starting, we need some sample data, and make sure out data
folder is set up properly. The file we're using is a simple 
CSV file we download using he `download.file()` function.

We will also download the packages we need. Especially [tidyverse](https://www.tidyverse.org/) which contains a large number of functions
to make data management easier.

```{r eval=FALSE,echo=TRUE,warning=FALSE,error=TRUE,message=TRUE}

dir.create("data")

download.file(
  "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/datacarpentry/r-socialsci/main/episodes/data/SAFI_clean.csv",
  "data/SAFI_clean.csv", mode = "wb"
)

install.packages("tidyverse")

```

Then we load the file in R, using the `read_csv()` function from the
tidyverse package

```{r eval=TRUE,echo=TRUE,warning=FALSE,error=TRUE,message=FALSE}

library(tidyverse)

interviews <- read_csv("data/SAFI_clean.csv", 
  na = "NULL")

```
